previous_issues_status.notes: State documentation added via inline comment (lines 27-28) and _TERMINAL_STATES constant (line 32). Future maintainers can now understand the state space.
Lower priority items deferred. Acceptable for MVP scope.

observations: Stop check comments are clear and consistent across both Intercom and Coda pipelines
Print messages correctly identify the stage being interrupted (fetch, normalization, classification)
_TERMINAL_STATES constant serves dual purpose: enables cleanup and documents terminal states
Schema already had Literal type documenting valid states - this was a strength in Round 1
summary: M1 addressed with appropriate inline documentation. State machine is now understandable. Stop check comments are clear and follow consistent pattern. No new maintainability concerns introduced. Code remains maintainable for MVP scope.
